title: Understanding Ionic Strength
text: Ionic strength is a measure of the concentration of ions in a solution. It takes into account both the concentration and the charge of the ions present.

title: Factors Affecting Ionic Strength
text: Consider how the concentration and charge of ions in a solution might affect the ionic strength. Higher charges and concentrations generally lead to higher ionic strength.

hintAnswer: Ionic strength increases as the solution contains higher concentrations of ions with larger charges.
title: Analyzing the Options
text: Which option correctly describes the relationship between ionic strength and ion $$\frac{concentration}{charge}$$?
choices: Ionic strength depends only on the number of moles of solvent.
Ionic strength is always the same for all $$0.10$$ M electrolyte solutions.
Ionic strength increases as the solution contains higher concentrations of ions with larger charges.
Ionic strength decreases when more electrolyte is added to solution.
